intro: Schultesia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, rounded fruits that contain seeds. Schultesia mexicana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
